scenarioDescription:
The K2-263 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-263 is a star with 0.88 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.85 times its radius. It is located 529.94 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 7 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

K2-263 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-263 system


K2-263 b

K2-263 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-12, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.26 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-263 b is 14.809 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-263 b is 2.410 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-263 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-263, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-263 - System With 1 Exoplanet
